Gaudry wrote:
> Hello,
> 
> I'm using Heritrix 1.8 and I configured a profile based on
> "deciding-default".
> 
> I tried crawls with about 200 URL and max-toe-threads at 500 and it's
> very slow, with an average of 25 active threads, 3 URI/s and 60 Kb/s.
> The others ToeThreads are in status "ABOUT_TO_GET_URI".
> 
> There is also 149 queues with 42 active and 107 exhausted.
> 
> I already reduced some 'waiting' parameters of the Frontier like
> delay-factor, min-delay-ms, ...	
> 
> Do you have an idea of what is happening ? 

It may be crawling as fast as it can while respecting the politeness 
settings. Heritrix will only open one request to any one host at a time, 
and will pause between requests in accordance with the various 'delay' 
settings.

With 149 queues, that means there are only 149 target sites available 
with URIs to crawl. Having more than 149 ToeThreads won't help.

Still, only 3 URI/s seems low, unless either:
(1) You are very bandwidth-constrained
(2) The resources your are crawling are very large
(3) Your target sites are unresponsive/unreachable, so most are waiting 
for a connection-timeout most of the time

The threads report or crawl log might help distinguish among these, or 
suggest what else is amiss. Even just the single line summary of thread 
statuses (from the 'reports' page) might help.

- Gordon @ IA
